base.comment: This token is targeted exclusively for font-size derived calculations. Apply `font-size-medium` and similar for component font size property use.

original.comment: This token is targeted exclusively for font-size derived calculations. Apply `font-size-medium` and similar for component font size property use.

base.name: font-size-base

x-small.comment: `x` stands for extra. In this case extra small.

original.comment: `x` stands for extra. In this case extra small.

x-small.name: font-size-x-small

color.comment: The colors are given numbers corresponding to their contrast, starting with 100 for the brightest to 700 for the darkest. Note, that single color options of a tone, white, black and purple, don't carry a number. Same goes for transparent.

accent.comment: Accent color is used for certain HTML5 elements like checkbox and progress bar.

original.comment: Accent color is used for certain HTML5 elements like checkbox and progress bar.

accent.name: color-accent

modifier-gray100-translucent.comment: TODO: Not part of DS Figma yet. Equals `color-gray100` on white. Was `rgba( 0, 24, 73, calc( 7 / 255 ) )` before, but due to Less compiler issue, we need to provide calculated value. See T326591.

original.comment: TODO: Not part of DS Figma yet. Equals `color-gray100` on white. Was `rgba( 0, 24, 73, calc( 7 / 255 ) )` before, but due to Less compiler issue, we need to provide calculated value. See T326591.

modifier-gray100-translucent.name: color-modifier-gray100-translucent

modifier-gray200-translucent.comment: TODO: Not part of DS Figma yet. Equals `color-gray200` on white. Was `rgba( 0, 24, 73, calc( 21 / 255 ) )` before, but due to Less compiler issue, we need to provide calculated value. See T326591.

original.comment: TODO: Not part of DS Figma yet. Equals `color-gray200` on white. Was `rgba( 0, 24, 73, calc( 21 / 255 ) )` before, but due to Less compiler issue, we need to provide calculated value. See T326591.

modifier-gray200-translucent.name: color-modifier-gray200-translucent

modifier-blue600-translucent.comment: TODO: Not part of DS Figma yet. Note, that WikimediaUI Base's `rgba( 41, 98, 204, 0.1 )` was not a modifier of Blue600, while this is.

original.comment: TODO: Not part of DS Figma yet. Note, that WikimediaUI Base's `rgba( 41, 98, 204, 0.1 )` was not a modifier of Blue600, while this is.

modifier-blue600-translucent.name: color-modifier-blue600-translucent

original.comment: Aimed to be replaced by `color.gray600` in future.

breakpoint.comment: Breakpoints. Maximum available screen width to be considered a certain device type.

mobile.comment: A mobile device's maximum available screen width. Many older feature phones have screens smaller than this value.

original.comment: A mobile device's maximum available screen width. Many older feature phones have screens smaller than this value.

mobile.name: max-width-breakpoint-mobile

tablet.comment: A tablet device's maximum available screen width. Note, the size chosen is eager to be re-evaluated with Web team and Product Analytics.

tablet.name: max-width-breakpoint-tablet

desktop.comment: A desktop device's maximum available screen width.

original.comment: A desktop device's maximum available screen width.

100.comment: Defining `rgba()` as combination of color and opacity tokens is overly complex in Style Dictionary. Therefore adding drop shadow colors here.

original.comment: Defining `rgba()` as combination of color and opacity tokens is overly complex in Style Dictionary. Therefore adding drop shadow colors here.

100.name: box-shadow-100

box-shadow.comment: Don't sub-group inset and drop shadows as themes might choose doing differently.

original.comment: Only visible at bottom.

drop-small.comment: This features color as part of the theme token value.

original.comment: This features color as part of the theme token value.

drop-small.name: box-shadow-drop-small

drop-medium.comment: This features color as part of the theme token value.

original.comment: This features color as part of the theme token value.

original.comment: This features color as part of the theme token value.

color.comment: Separate `box-shadow` colors from colors to apply clean, property specific tokens.

font-family.comment: TODO: Re-evaluate and make possibly obsolete with multi-platform tokens output.

100.comment: Provide better operating system-specific readability. See T175877. `system-ui` is currently not an option due to OS/language combination issues. See T175877#4776576.
Provide better operating system-specific readability. See T175877. `system-ui` is currently not an option due to OS/language combination issues. See T175877#4776576.
Provide better operating system-specific monospace stack. See T209915.
Provide better operating system-specific monospace stack. See T209915.

base.comment: Reference Vector's default fallback sans instead of the deprecated value `font-family-sans` in WikimediaUI Base.

original.comment: Reference Vector's default fallback sans instead of the deprecated value `font-family-sans` in WikimediaUI Base.

base.name: font-family-base

heading-main.comment: Legacy value from WikimediaUI Base. Use for first heading special treatment.

original.comment: Legacy value from WikimediaUI Base. Use for first heading special treatment.

heading-main.name: font-family-heading-main

font-weight.comment: Set `100` to `normal` default `400` to move away from property value collisions.

xxx-small.comment: `x` stands for extra. In this case extra-extra-extra small.

original.comment: `x` stands for extra. In this case extra-extra-extra small.

xxx-small.name: line-height-xxx-small

100.comment: `ease` for system initiated transitions. See T77949. It's also the initial value.

original.comment: `ease` for system initiated transitions. See T77949. It's also the initial value.

100.name: transition-timing-function-100

original.comment: `ease-out` for human initiated transitions.

wmui-color.comment: Note: Deprecated color names necessary for WikimediaUI Base backwards-compatibility!

disabled.comment: Components like Buttons, Checkboxes, Radios, ProgressBars.

original.comment: Components like Buttons, Checkboxes, Radios, ProgressBars.

disabled.name: background-color-disabled

original.comment: Components like TextInputs, Selects.

backdrop-light.comment: Backdrop is the term used by CSS Fullscreen API and is used to dim the background when a modal Dialog is open. Also known as overlay mask.

original.comment: Backdrop is the term used by CSS Fullscreen API and is used to dim the background when a modal Dialog is open. Also known as overlay mask.

backdrop-light.name: background-color-backdrop-light

base.comment: Background Colors for static elements (for page layout, sections, etc.) from here on.

original.comment: Background Colors for static elements (for page layout, sections, etc.) from here on.

base.name: background-color-base

offset.comment: position.offset is a Codex token shorthand to use in `top`, `left`, `bottom`, `right`, and `margin` properties for elements that expand over default boundary box.

30.comment: This token is an exception to the scale.  Used as vertical `padding` in inputs and controls to achieve the default 32px component height.

original.comment: This token is an exception to the scale.  Used as vertical `padding` in inputs and controls to achieve the default 32px component height.

30.name: spacing-30

35.comment: This token is an exception to the scale.  Used as `padding` of the ToggleSwitch component.

original.comment: This token is an exception to the scale.  Used as `padding` of the ToggleSwitch component.

35.name: spacing-35

half.comment: From here on, spacing tokens which are used for positioning values.

original.comment: From here on, spacing tokens which are used for positioning values.

half.name: spacing-half

horizontal-button.comment: Padding should equal 12px of spacing minus the width of the border

original.comment: Padding should equal 12px of spacing minus the width of the border

horizontal-button.name: spacing-horizontal-button

horizontal-button-icon-only.comment: Padding should equal 6px of spacing minus the width of the border

original.comment: Padding should equal 6px of spacing minus the width of the border

horizontal-button-icon-only.name: spacing-horizontal-button-icon-only

horizontal-button-large.comment: Padding should equal 16px of spacing minus the width of the border

original.comment: Padding should equal 16px of spacing minus the width of the border

horizontal-button-large.name: spacing-horizontal-button-large

horizontal-input-text-two-end-icons.comment: Rely on `calc()` to make token output usable in all formats. When there are two end icons, (i.e. a clear icon and an end icon), we need to double the horizontal padding and account for the size of the extra icon. This token can be used to calculate the horizontal position of the clear icon and the padding-end of the text input.

original.comment: Rely on `calc()` to make token output usable in all formats. When there are two end icons, (i.e. a clear icon and an end icon), we need to double the horizontal padding and account for the size of the extra icon. This token can be used to calculate the horizontal position of the clear icon and the padding-end of the text input.

horizontal-input-text-two-end-icons.name: spacing-horizontal-input-text-two-end-icons

start-typeahead-search-figure.comment: The amount of space between the TypeaheadSearch figure's parent component and the TypeaheadSearch figure (input icon container, search result thumbnail, and footer icon container). We want this space to be uniform so that the figures vertically line up nicely. We use the same horizontal padding as the MenuItem.

original.comment: The amount of space between the TypeaheadSearch figure's parent component and the TypeaheadSearch figure (input icon container, search result thumbnail, and footer icon container). We want this space to be uniform so that the figures vertically line up nicely. We use the same horizontal padding as the MenuItem.

start-typeahead-search-figure.name: spacing-start-typeahead-search-figure

start-typeahead-search-icon.comment: The padding required for the icon to center align with the menu item thumbnail. We calculate the difference in size and add it to the expected spacing.

original.comment: The padding required for the icon to center align with the menu item thumbnail. We calculate the difference in size and add it to the expected spacing.

start-typeahead-search-icon.name: spacing-start-typeahead-search-icon

typeahead-search-focus-addition.comment: The amount the width of the input increases when it is focused to allow for the extra spacing around the search figures. The caret position should remain static. This calculates the padding-left of the input when expanded minus the padding-left of the input when not expanded. (Note that both padding values actually include `@spacing-50` as well, but it was left out of the calculation for simplicity's sake.)

original.comment: The amount the width of the input increases when it is focused to allow for the extra spacing around the search figures. The caret position should remain static. This calculates the padding-left of the input when expanded minus the padding-left of the input when not expanded. (Note that both padding values actually include `@spacing-50` as well, but it was left out of the calculation for simplicity's sake.)

typeahead-search-focus-addition.name: spacing-typeahead-search-focus-addition

border.comment: Note, that only most common shorthands are provided given the number of border-color variants.

circle.comment: Use `50%` for circle or ellipsis. See https://stackoverflow.com/a/29966500

original.comment: Use `50%` for circle or ellipsis. See https://stackoverflow.com/a/29966500

circle.name: border-radius-circle

base--focus.comment: Enable Windows high contrast mode on certain widgets, that have default outlines overridden.

original.comment: Enable Windows high contrast mode on certain widgets, that have default outlines overridden.

base--focus.name: outline-base--focus

progressive--focus.comment: Use in places where no more customized focus styles are provided, for example on generic `:focus`.

original.comment: Use in places where no more customized focus styles are provided, for example on generic `:focus`.

progressive--focus.name: outline-color-progressive--focus
